summary.span: 表示对 或 可以包含的所有元素的事件和布局进行管理的抽象基类。

span.span: Represents the abstract base class that manages events and layout for all the elements that a or can contain.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 是可在控件或控件中包含的元素 (如按钮、组合框、文本框或标签), 这类似于 Windows 快捷菜单。 A is an element such as a button, combo box, text box, or label that can be contained in a control or a control, which is similar to a Windows shortcut menu. 类管理绘制和键盘和鼠标输入, 包括用于这些元素的拖放输入, 而类管理元素自身内的事件和布局。 The class manages the painting and keyboard and mouse input, including drag-and-drop input, for these elements, and the class manages events and layout within the elements themselves. 类直接从继承, 或者它们从或间接继承。 classes either inherit directly from , or they inherit indirectly from through or . 控件必须包含在 、、或中,不能直接添加到窗体中。 controls must be contained in a , , , or and cannot be added directly to a form. 各种容器类旨在包含控件的适当子集。The various container classes are designed to contain an appropriate subset of controls. **注意**给定的不能有多个父级。**Note** A given cannot have more than one parent . 必须复制并将其添加到其他控件。You must copy of the and add it to other controls. 下表显示从类派生的元素, 因此可以在或中承载。The following table shows the elements that derive from the class and which therefore can be hosted in a or . |元素Element|说明Description| |-------------|-----------------| ||支持图像和文本的工具栏按钮。A toolbar button that supports images and text.| ||通常用于状态栏或注释或标题的文本标签。A text label typically used in a status bar or as a comment or title.| ||不可选择的空间或具有可直观分组元素的垂直条的空间。A non-selectable space or space with a vertical bar that visually groups elements.| ||承载、 、、其他 Windows 窗体控件或自定义控件的。 A that hosts a , , , other Windows Forms controls, or custom controls.

是一个文本框, 用户可以在其中输入文本, 以及一个列表, 用户可从中选择文本以填充文本框。A is a text box in which the user can enter text, along with a list from which the user can select text to fill the text box.

允许用户输入文本。A enables the user to enter text.

表示中包含的 Windows 进度栏控件。 A represents a Windows progress bar control contained in a .| || 承载 、和的。A that hosts a , , and .

是显示在菜单或上下文菜单上的可选择选项。A is a selectable option displayed on a menu or context menu.

是常规按钮和下拉按钮的组合。A is a combination of a regular button and a drop-down button.

是支持下拉功能的按钮。A is a button that supports drop-down functionality.| ||控件中的面板。A panel in a control.| ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何实现自定义控件。The following code example demonstrates how to implement a custom control. remarks.format: ## Remarks 要获取或设置 属性，必须添加对与 .NET Framework 一起安装的 Accessibility 程序集的引用。To get or set the property, you must add a reference to the Accessibility assembly installed with the .NET Framework. 有关可访问对象的详细信息, 请参阅文档的[Active Accessibility](/windows/desktop/winauto/microsoft-active-accessibility)部分。For more information about accessible objects, see the [Active Accessibility](/windows/desktop/winauto/microsoft-active-accessibility) section of the documentation. 有关示例, 请参阅类。For samples, see the class.

value.span: 控件的默认操作说明，供具有辅助功能的客户端应用程序使用。

span.span: The default action description of the control, for use by accessibility client applications.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 对象的属性介绍了从用户的角度来看对象的主要操作方法。An object's property describes the object's primary method of manipulation from the user's viewpoint. 此属性应为谓词或短动词短语。This property should be a verb or a short verb phrase. > [!NOTE] > 并非所有对象都有默认操作, 一些对象可能具有与其属性相关的默认操作, 如以下示例中所示:Not all objects have default actions, and some objects might have a default action that is related to its property, such as in the following examples: - 选中的复选框的默认操作为 "取消选中" 且值为 "已选中"。A selected check box has a default action of "Uncheck" and a value of "Checked." - 清除的复选框的默认操作为 "检查", 值为 "未选中"。A cleared check box has a default action of "Check" and a value of "Unchecked." - 标记为 "**打印**" 的按钮具有默认操作 "按", 没有任何值。A button labeled **Print** has a default action of "Press," with no value. - 显示 "**打印机**" 的标签或文本框控件没有默认操作, 但其值为 "Printer"。A label or a text box control that shows **Printer** has no default action, but would have a value of "Printer." 有关可访问对象的属性的详细信息, 请参阅[描述性属性的内容](/windows/desktop/winauto/content-of-descriptive-properties)。For more information about properties of accessible objects, see [Content of Descriptive Properties](/windows/desktop/winauto/content-of-descriptive-properties). 有关示例, 请参阅类。For samples, see the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 对象的属性提供有关对象的视觉外观的文本说明。An object's property provides a textual description about an object's visual appearance. 描述主要用于为弱视用户或盲人用户提供更大的上下文, 但也可用于上下文搜索或其他应用程序。The description is primarily used to provide greater context for low-vision or blind users, but can also be used for context searching or other applications. 如果说明不明显, 或者根据对象的、 、 和属性, 则此属性是必需的。The property is needed if the description is not obvious, or if it is not redundant based on the object's , , , and properties. 例如, 标记为 **"确定"** 的按钮不需要额外信息, 而显示仙人掌图片的按钮将是。For example, a button labeled **OK** would not need additional information, but a button that shows a picture of a cactus would. 和和 (也许是仙人掌按钮的属性) 将描述其用途, 但属性会传达不太有形的信息, 如 "显示仙人掌图片的按钮"。 The and and, perhaps, properties for the cactus button would describe its purpose, but the property would convey information that is less tangible, such as "A button that shows a picture of a cactus." 有关可访问对象的属性的详细信息, 请参阅[描述性属性的内容](/windows/desktop/winauto/content-of-descriptive-properties)。For more information about properties of accessible objects, see [Content of Descriptive Properties](/windows/desktop/winauto/content-of-descriptive-properties). 有关示例, 请参阅类。For samples, see the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在堆栈溢出布局中, 将属性与属性一起使用, 以控制中的项的对齐方式, 或确定它们已对齐的结束。In a stack overflow layout, use the property along with the property to control the end to which items are aligned in a , or to determine the end to which they are already aligned. 如果属性为, 则标记为的项将与的左侧对齐, 并且标记的项将与右侧对齐。 If the property is , items marked as are aligned to the left side of the and items marked are aligned to the right. 如果属性为, 则标记为的项将与的右边缘对齐, 并且标记的项的左侧对齐。 If the property is , items marked as are aligned to the right side of the and items marked are aligned to the left. > [!NOTE] > 在流和表布局中, 将忽略属性。In flow and table layouts, the property is ignored. 在 "流" 或 "表布局 " 中, 使用或属性对齐行或表单元中的项。In flow or table layout, use the or property to align the items within the row or table cell. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何设置属性。The following code example demonstrates how to set the property. 此代码示例是为类提供的更大示例的一部分。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用属性可定义自动调整的大小, 因为其父控件调整大小。 Use the property to define how a is automatically resized as its parent control is resized. 将控件锚定到其父控件可确保在调整父控件的大小时, 定位边缘与父控件边缘的相对位置保持不变。Anchoring a control to its parent control ensures that the anchored edges remain in the same position relative to the edges of the parent control when the parent control is resized. > [!NOTE] > 和属性是互相排斥。The and properties are mutually exclusive. 一次只能设置一个, 而最后一个集则优先。Only one can be set at a time, and the last one set takes precedence.

summary.span: 在单击 时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the is clicked.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件将传递给其事件处理程序, 因此它只指示已发生单击。The event passes an to its event handler, so it only indicates that a click has occurred. 如果需要更具体的鼠标信息 (按钮、单击次数、滚轮旋转或位置), 请使用传递到事件处理程序的和事件。If you need more specific mouse information (button, number of clicks, wheel rotation, or location), use the and events which pass a to the event handler. 双击由用户操作系统的鼠标设置确定。A double-click is determined by the mouse settings of the user's operating system. 用户可以设置两次单击鼠标按钮之间的时间以便将这两次单击认为是双击而不是两次单击。The user can set the time between clicks of a mouse button that should be considered a double-click rather than two clicks. 每次双击控件时都会引发该事件。The event is raised every time a control is double-clicked. 例如, 如果的和事件有两个事件处理程序, 则在双击窗体并调用这两个方法时, 将引发和事件。For example, if you have two event handlers for the and events of a , the and events are raised when the form is double-clicked and both methods are called. 如果双击的项不支持该事件, 则可能会引发此事件两次。If an item is double-clicked that does not support the event, the event might be raised twice. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何设置、 和属性, 并处理事件。The following code example demonstrates how to set the , , and properties, and handle the event. 若要运行此示例, 请将以下代码粘贴到包含已命名`movingToolStrip`的窗体中, 并在窗体`Load`的构造函数或事件处理程序中调用`InitializeMovingToolStrip` 。To run this example, paste the following code into a form that contains a named `movingToolStrip` and call `InitializeMovingToolStrip` in the form's constructor or `Load` event handler. summary.span: 获取或设置要停靠在其父控件上的 边框，并确定 如何随其父控件一起调整大小。

span.span: Gets or sets which borders are docked to its parent control and determines how a is resized with its parent.
One of the values.
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性仅适用于流布局。This property applies only to flow layouts. 使用属性可定义自动调整的大小, 因为其父控件调整大小。 Use the property to define how a is automatically resized as its parent control is resized. 例如, 将设置为会导致将自身与父控件的左边缘对齐, 并在父控件调整大小时进行重设大小。For example, setting to causes the to align itself with the left edges of its parent control and to resize as the parent control is resized. 控件按其 Z 顺序停靠, 这是窗体上的控件沿窗体的 Z 轴 (深度) 的可视化分层。Controls are docked in their Z-order, which is the visual layering of controls on a form along the form's Z-axis (depth). 控件可以停靠到其父容器的一个边缘, 也可以停靠到所有边缘并填充父容器。A control can be docked to one edge of its parent container or can be docked to all edges and fill the parent container. > [!NOTE] > 和属性是互相排斥。The and properties are mutually exclusive. 一次只能设置一个, 而最后一个集则优先。Only one can be set at a time, and the last one set takes precedence.

exception.span: 分配的值不是 值之一。

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event DoubleClick As EventHandler

summary.span: 当用鼠标双击项时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the item is double-clicked with the mouse.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 双击由用户操作系统的鼠标设置确定。A double-click is determined by the mouse settings of the user's operating system. 用户可以设置两次单击鼠标按钮之间的时间以便将这两次单击认为是双击而不是两次单击。The user can set the time between clicks of a mouse button that should be considered a double-click rather than two clicks. 每次双击控件时都会引发该事件。The event is raised every time a control is double-clicked. 例如, 如果的和事件有两个事件处理程序, 则在双击窗体并调用这两个方法时, 将引发和事件。For example, if you have two event handlers for the and events of a , the and events are raised when the form is double-clicked and both methods are called. 如果双击的项不支持该事件, 则可能会引发此事件两次。If an item is double-clicked that does not support the event, the event might be raised twice. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用此成员。The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. 在此示例中, 事件处理程序报告事件的发生。In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the event. 此报表可帮助你了解何时发生事件, 并可帮助你进行调试。This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. 若要报告多个事件或频繁发生的事件, 请考虑将消息替换为多行或将其追加到多行。To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing with or appending the message to a multiline . 若要运行示例代码, 请将其粘贴到一个项目中, 该项目包含从继承的类型的实例, 如 或。To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of a type that inherits from , such as a or . 然后命名该实例`ToolStripItem1` , 并确保事件处理程序与事件相关联。Then name the instance `ToolStripItem1` and ensure that the event handler is associated with the event. remarks.format: ## Remarks 的 和属性处于屏幕坐标中, 而不是客户端坐标。 The and properties of the are in screen coordinates, not client coordinates. 有关处理事件的详细信息, 请参阅[处理和引发事件](~/docs/standard/events/index.md)。For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将和属性转换为客户端。The following code example shows how to convert the and properties to a client . 此代码示例是为类提供的更大示例的一部分。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 在拖放操作过程中, 当用户首次将鼠标光标拖到项上时, 将引发事件。The event is raised when the user first drags the mouse cursor over the item during a drag-and-drop operation. 以下备注说明了如何和何时引发与拖放操作相关的事件。The following remarks describe how and when events related to drag-and-drop operations are raised. 方法确定当前游标位置下的项。The method determines the item under the current cursor location. 然后, 它会检查该项是否为有效的拖放目标。It then checks to see if the item is a valid drop target. 如果该项是有效的拖放目标, 则会在指定了拖放效果的情况下引发事件。If the item is a valid drop target, the event is raised with the drag-and-drop effect specified. 有关拖放效果的列表，请参见 枚举。For a list of drag-and-drop effects, see the enumeration. 按以下方式跟踪鼠标光标位置、键盘状态和鼠标按钮状态的更改:Changes in the mouse cursor position, keyboard state, and mouse button state are tracked in the following manner: - 如果用户移出一个窗口，则引发 事件。If the user moves out of a window, the event is raised. - 如果鼠标进入另一个项, 则引发该控件的。If the mouse enters another item, the for that control is raised. - 如果鼠标移动但停留在同一项中, 则会引发事件。If the mouse moves but stays within the same item, the event is raised. 如果键盘或鼠标按钮状态发生了更改, 则会引发事件, 并确定是继续拖动、删除数据还是根据事件的 属性的值来取消操作。If there is a change in the keyboard or mouse button state, the event is raised and determines whether to continue the drag, to drop the data, or to cancel the operation based on the value of the property of the event's . 如果的值为, 则会引发事件以继续操作, 并且事件将以新效果引发, 以便可以设置适当的视觉反馈。If the value of is , the event is raised to continue the operation and the event is raised with the new effect so appropriate visual feedback can be set. 有关有效放置效果的列表，请参见 枚举。For a list of valid drop effects, see the enumeration. 和事件成对出现, 因此, 当鼠标移动到拖放目标上时, 将为用户提供有关鼠标位置的最新反馈, 如下所示:The and events are paired so that as the mouse moves across the drop target, the user is given the most up-to-date feedback on the mouse's position, as follows: - 如果的值为, 则放置效果值将返回到源, 以便源应用程序可以对源数据执行适当的操作; 例如, 如果是移动操作, 则剪切数据。If the value of is , the drop effect value is returned to the source, so the source application can perform the appropriate operation on the source data; for example, cut the data if the operation was a move. - 如果的值为, 则引发事件。If the value of is , the event is raised. > [!NOTE] > 的 和属性处于屏幕坐标中, 而不是客户端坐标。 The and properties of the are in screen coordinates, not client coordinates. 有关处理事件的详细信息, 请参阅[处理和引发事件](~/docs/standard/events/index.md)。For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将和属性转换为客户端。The following code example shows how to convert the and properties to a client . 此代码示例是为类提供的更大示例的一部分。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 当用户将光标拖出控件或用户取消当前拖放操作时, 将引发事件。The event is raised when the user drags the cursor out of the control or the user cancels the current drag-and-drop operation. 以下备注说明了如何和何时引发与拖放操作相关的事件。The following remarks describe how and when events related to drag-and-drop operations are raised. 方法确定当前游标位置下的项。The method determines the item under the current cursor location. 然后, 它会检查该项是否为有效的拖放目标。It then checks to see if the item is a valid drop target. 如果该项是有效的拖放目标, 则会在指定了拖放效果的情况下引发事件。If the item is a valid drop target, the event is raised with the drag-and-drop effect specified. 有关拖放效果的列表，请参见 枚举。For a list of drag-and-drop effects, see the enumeration. 按以下方式跟踪鼠标光标位置、键盘状态和鼠标按钮状态的更改:Changes in the mouse cursor position, keyboard state, and mouse button state are tracked in the following manner: - 如果用户移出一个窗口，则引发 事件。If the user moves out of a window, the event is raised. - 如果鼠标进入另一个项, 则引发该控件的。If the mouse enters another item, the for that control is raised. - 如果鼠标移动但停留在同一项中, 则会引发事件。If the mouse moves but stays within the same item, the event is raised. 如果键盘或鼠标按钮状态发生了更改, 则会引发事件, 并确定是继续拖动、删除数据还是根据事件的 属性的值来取消操作。If there is a change in the keyboard or mouse button state, the event is raised and determines whether to continue the drag, to drop the data, or to cancel the operation based on the value of the property of the event's . 如果的值为, 则会引发事件以继续操作, 并且事件将以新效果引发, 以便可以设置适当的视觉反馈。If the value of is , the event is raised to continue the operation and the event is raised with the new effect so appropriate visual feedback can be set. 有关有效放置效果的列表，请参见 枚举。For a list of valid drop effects, see the enumeration. 和事件成对出现, 因此, 当鼠标移动到拖放目标上时, 将为用户提供有关鼠标位置的最新反馈, 如下所示:The and events are paired so that as the mouse moves across the drop target, the user is given the most up-to-date feedback on the mouse's position, as follows: - 如果的值为, 则放置效果值将返回到源, 以便源应用程序可以对源数据执行适当的操作; 例如, 如果是移动操作, 则剪切数据。If the value of is , the drop effect value is returned to the source, so the source application can perform the appropriate operation on the source data; for example, cut the data if the operation was a move. - 如果的值为, 则引发事件。If the value of is , the event is raised. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用此成员。The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. 在此示例中, 事件处理程序报告事件的发生。In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the event. 此报表可帮助你了解何时发生事件, 并可帮助你进行调试。This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. 若要报告多个事件或频繁发生的事件, 请考虑将消息替换为多行或将其追加到多行。To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing with or appending the message to a multiline . 若要运行示例代码, 请将其粘贴到一个项目中, 该项目包含从继承的类型的实例, 如 或。To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of a type that inherits from , such as a or . 然后命名该实例`ToolStripItem1` , 并确保事件处理程序与事件相关联。Then name the instance `ToolStripItem1` and ensure that the event handler is associated with the event. summary.span: 在执行拖动操作期间发生。

span.span: Occurs during a drag operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当启动拖放操作时, 将引发事件。The event is raised when a drag-and-drop operation is started. 事件允许拖动事件的源修改鼠标指针的外观, 以便在拖放操作过程中为用户提供视觉反馈。The event allows the source of a drag event to modify the appearance of the mouse pointer in order to give the user visual feedback during a drag-and-drop operation. 以下备注说明了如何和何时引发与拖放操作相关的事件。The following remarks describe how and when events related to drag-and-drop operations are raised. 方法确定当前游标位置下的项。The method determines the item under the current cursor location. 然后, 它会检查该项是否为有效的拖放目标。It then checks to see if the item is a valid drop target. 如果该项是有效的拖放目标, 则会在指定了拖放效果的情况下引发事件。If the item is a valid drop target, the event is raised with the drag-and-drop effect specified. 有关拖放效果的列表，请参见 枚举。For a list of drag-and-drop effects, see the enumeration. 按以下方式跟踪鼠标光标位置、键盘状态和鼠标按钮状态的更改:Changes in the mouse cursor position, keyboard state, and mouse button state are tracked in the following manner: - 如果用户移出一个窗口，则引发 事件。If the user moves out of a window, the event is raised. - 如果鼠标进入另一个项, 则引发该控件的。If the mouse enters another item, the for that control is raised. - 如果鼠标移动但停留在同一项中, 则会引发事件。If the mouse moves but stays within the same item, the event is raised. 如果键盘或鼠标按钮状态发生了更改, 则会引发事件, 并确定是继续拖动、删除数据还是根据事件的 属性的值来取消操作。If there is a change in the keyboard or mouse button state, the event is raised and determines whether to continue the drag, to drop the data, or to cancel the operation based on the value of the property of the event's . 如果的值为, 则会引发事件以继续操作, 并且事件将以新效果引发, 以便可以设置适当的视觉反馈。If the value of is , the event is raised to continue the operation and the event is raised with the new effect so appropriate visual feedback can be set. 有关有效放置效果的列表，请参见 枚举。For a list of valid drop effects, see the enumeration. 和事件成对出现, 因此, 当鼠标移动到拖放目标上时, 将为用户提供有关鼠标位置的最新反馈, 如下所示:The and events are paired so that as the mouse moves across the drop target, the user is given the most up-to-date feedback on the mouse's position, as follows: - 如果的值为, 则放置效果值将返回到源, 以便源应用程序可以对源数据执行适当的操作; 例如, 如果是移动操作, 则剪切数据。If the value of is , the drop effect value is returned to the source, so the source application can perform the appropriate operation on the source data; for example, cut the data if the operation was a move. - 如果的值为, 则引发事件。If the value of is , the event is raised. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用此成员。The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. 在此示例中, 事件处理程序报告事件的发生。In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the event. 此报表可帮助你了解何时发生事件, 并可帮助你进行调试。This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. 若要报告多个事件或频繁发生的事件, 请考虑将消息替换为多行或将其追加到多行。To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing with or appending the message to a multiline . 若要运行示例代码, 请将其粘贴到一个项目中, 该项目包含从继承的类型的实例, 如 或。To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of a type that inherits from , such as a or . 然后命名该实例`ToolStripItem1` , 并确保事件处理程序与事件相关联。Then name the instance `ToolStripItem1` and ensure that the event handler is associated with the event. remarks.format: ## Remarks 、 、、和属性与图像处理的各个方面相关。 The , , , , and properties pertain to various aspects of image handling. 通过直接设置这些属性或通过设置运行时属性来使用控件中的图像。Use images in controls by setting these properties directly or by setting the run-time-only property. 图像缩放是通过和中的属性交互确定的, 如下所示:Image scaling is determined by the interaction of properties in both and , as follows: - 最终映像的小数位数, 由图像设置和容器设置的组合确定。 is the scale of the final image as determined by the combination of the image's setting and the container's setting. - 如果 为`true` (默认值) 并且为, 则不会进行图像缩放, 并且大小是最大项的大小, 或者是指定的最小大小。If is `true` (the default) and is , no image scaling occurs, and the size is that of the largest item, or a prescribed minimum size. - 如果为`false`且为,则不会发生图像和缩放。 If is `false` and is , neither image nor scaling occurs. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示了的 、、和属性。 The following code example demonstrates the , , , and properties for a . 此示例是类概述中提供的一个更大示例的一部分。This example is part of a larger example available in the class overview. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法在窗口消息预处理过程中调用, 以确定给定的输入字符是否应经过预处理或直接发送到。This method is called during window message preprocessing to determine whether the given input character should be preprocessed or sent directly to the . 如果该方法返回`true`, 则将指定的字符直接发送到。If the method returns `true`, the specified character is sent directly to the . 但是, 如果该方法返回`false`, 则该字符将经过预处理并仅在预处理阶段不使用它时发送到。However, if the method returns `false`, the character is preprocessed and only sent to the if it is not consumed by the preprocessing phase. 字符的预处理包括检查字符是否为另一个控件的助记键。The preprocessing of a character includes checking whether the character is a mnemonic of another control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在消息预处理过程中调用此方法来处理命令键。This method is called during message preprocessing to handle command keys. 命令键是始终优先于常规输入键的键。Command keys are keys that always take precedence over regular input keys. 命令键的示例包括快捷键和菜单快捷方式。Examples of command keys include accelerators and menu shortcuts. 方法必须返回`true`以指示它已处理命令键, 或`false`指示该密钥不是命令键。The method must return `true` to indicate that it has processed the command key, or `false` to indicate that the key is not a command key. 方法的基类实现在所有情况下`false`均返回。The base-class implementation of method returns `false` in all cases.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用此方法可使项有机会处理助记键字符。This method is called to give an item the opportunity to process a mnemonic character. 方法应确定项是否处于用于处理助记键的状态, 以及给定字符是否表示助记键。The method should determine whether the item is in a state to process mnemonics and if whether the given character represents a mnemonic. 如果是这样, 则该方法应执行与助记键关联的操作`true`, 并返回。If so, the method should perform the action associated with the mnemonic and return `true`. 如果不是, 则该方法`false`应返回。If not, the method should return `false`. 此基类实现依赖于宿主控件来调用方法, 以确定给定字符是否与项文本中的助记键匹配。This base-class implementation relies on the host control to call the method to determine whether the given character matches a mnemonic in the item's text. 在这种情况下, 方法将引发事件, `true`并返回。In this case, the method raises the event and returns `true`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 你应使用类来允许用户通过按 F1 键来调用辅助性对象上的帮助。You should use the class to allow users to invoke help on your accessible object by pressing the F1 key. 使用可以在对象中提供完整信息。Using the provides you with complete information in the object. 有关处理事件的详细信息, 请参阅[处理和引发事件](~/docs/standard/events/index.md)。For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用此成员。The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. 在此示例中, 事件处理程序报告事件的发生。In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the event. 此报表可帮助你了解何时发生事件, 并可帮助你进行调试。This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. 若要报告多个事件或频繁发生的事件, 请考虑将消息替换为多行或将其追加到多行。To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing with or appending the message to a multiline . 若要运行示例代码, 请将其粘贴到一个项目中, 该项目包含从继承的类型的实例, 如 或。To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of a type that inherits from , such as a or . 然后命名该实例`ToolStripItem1` , 并确保事件处理程序与事件相关联。Then name the instance `ToolStripItem1` and ensure that the event handler is associated with the event. MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event QueryContinueDrag As QueryContinueDragEventHandler

summary.span: 在拖放操作期间发生，并且允许拖动源确定是否应取消拖放操作。

span.span: Occurs during a drag-and-drop operation and allows the drag source to determine whether the drag-and-drop operation should be canceled.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 拖放操作期间键盘或鼠标按钮状态发生更改时, 会引发事件。The event is raised when there is a change in the keyboard or mouse button state during a drag-and-drop operation. 此事件允许拖动源确定是否应取消拖放操作。The event allows the drag source to determine whether the drag-and-drop operation should be canceled. 以下备注说明了如何和何时引发与拖放操作相关的事件。The following remarks describe how and when events related to drag-and-drop operations are raised. 方法确定当前游标位置下的项。The method determines the item under the current cursor location. 然后, 它会检查该项是否为有效的拖放目标。It then checks to see if the item is a valid drop target. 如果该项是有效的拖放目标, 则会在指定了拖放效果的情况下引发事件。If the item is a valid drop target, the event is raised with the drag-and-drop effect specified. 有关拖放效果的列表，请参见 枚举。For a list of drag-and-drop effects, see the enumeration. 按以下方式跟踪鼠标光标位置、键盘状态和鼠标按钮状态的更改:Changes in the mouse cursor position, keyboard state, and mouse button state are tracked in the following manner: - 如果用户移出一个窗口，则引发 事件。If the user moves out of a window, the event is raised. - 如果鼠标进入另一个项, 则引发该控件的。If the mouse enters another item, the for that control is raised. - 如果鼠标移动但停留在同一项中, 则会引发事件。If the mouse moves but stays within the same item, the event is raised. 如果键盘或鼠标按钮状态发生了更改, 则会引发事件, 并确定是继续拖动、删除数据还是根据事件的 属性的值来取消操作。If there is a change in the keyboard or mouse button state, the event is raised and determines whether to continue the drag, to drop the data, or to cancel the operation based on the value of the property of the event's . 如果的值为`Continue`, 则会引发事件以继续操作, 并且事件将以新效果引发, 以便可以设置适当的视觉反馈。If the value of is `Continue`, the event is raised to continue the operation and the event is raised with the new effect so appropriate visual feedback can be set. 有关有效放置效果的列表，请参见 枚举。For a list of valid drop effects, see the enumeration. 和事件成对出现, 因此, 当鼠标移动到拖放目标上时, 将为用户提供有关鼠标位置的最新反馈, 如下所示:The and events are paired so that as the mouse moves across the drop target, the user is given the most up-to-date feedback on the mouse's position, as follows: - 如果的值为`Drop`, 则放置效果值将返回到源, 以便源应用程序可以对源数据执行适当的操作; 例如, 如果是移动操作, 则剪切数据。If the value of is `Drop`, the drop effect value is returned to the source, so the source application can perform the appropriate operation on the source data; for example, cut the data if the operation was a move. - 如果的值为`Cancel`, 则引发事件。If the value of is `Cancel`, the event is raised. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用此成员。The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. 在此示例中, 事件处理程序报告事件的发生。In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the event. 此报表可帮助你了解何时发生事件, 并可帮助你进行调试。This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. 若要报告多个事件或频繁发生的事件, 请考虑将消息替换为多行或将其追加到多行。To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing with or appending the message to a multiline . 若要运行示例代码, 请将其粘贴到一个项目中, 该项目包含从继承的类型的实例, 如 或。To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of a type that inherits from , such as a or . 然后命名该实例`ToolStripItem1` , 并确保事件处理程序与事件相关联。Then name the instance `ToolStripItem1` and ensure that the event handler is associated with the event. remarks.format: ## Remarks 引发事件时，将通过委托调用事件处理程序。Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[处理和引发事件](~/docs/standard/events/index.md)。For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md). 方法还允许派生类对事件进行处理而不必附加委托。The method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. 这是在派生类中处理事件的首选技术。This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

para.span: 当在派生类中重写时, 请确保调用基类的方法, 以便注册的委托接收事件。

span.span: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class' method so that registered delegates receive the event.
